page.title: 20The Church Garden Fete
page.content: On Saturday,23rd June,the annual{ {Church Garden Fete}was held at Westgarth,where it has been held for the last forty years.At the fete there were various{stalls}and{games}and a raffle for a microwave oven.Some of the games were ingenious.{Eggs in {Sawdust}was the most popular one.Egg shells,together with one whole egg, were half covered by sawdust and you had to detect the whole egg.These games,run by school children,raised{ {Â£50.}There was a{Sunday School Queen} and she had ten attendants,together with a retiring queen who had four attendants.They went in procession round the garden led by a{bell-girl} and a{flower-girl}who scattered rose petals in their path.The 1985 Queen was crowned and the fete declared open.A total of{Â£1900}was raised.
